The aim of this project is to create, build, and evaluate a miniature radon chamber that can replicate the processes of radon build-up and degradation in regulated settings.


Objectives: The project contributes to the advancement of knowledge in radon research, providing insights into radon dynamics and facilitating the development of effective strategies for mitigating indoor radon levels.


Building a radon chamber provides a controlled environment for conducting research, testing radon measurement devices, evaluating mitigation strategies, and educating individuals about radon risks and mitigation techniques.

Victor Gonzalez, Instructor
